FT Faculty Headcount:
Overview:
The Spring 2023 Excel file contains Central Connecticut State University’s Faculty & Student Credit Hour, Student Headcount Report. It summarizes faculty instructional activity, student enrollments, and sections taught across departments, divided between full-time (FT) and part-time (PT) faculty. The report also includes the percentage of student credit hours taught by each group, highlighting the distribution of teaching responsibilities across colleges.

Abbreviations Explained:

FT = Full-Time (faculty employed full-time)

PT = Part-Time (faculty employed part-time)

Faculty Headcount = Number of faculty teaching courses

Student Credit Hr = Total student credit hours taught (measure of workload)

Credit Hr/Faculty = Average student credit hours per faculty member

Student Headcount = Number of students enrolled in faculty-taught courses

Student Headcount/Faculty = Average number of students per faculty member

Sections Taught = Number of course sections delivered

% Credit Hr by FT Faculty / PT Faculty = Percentage of total student credit hours taught by full-time versus part-time faculty
